title: Kassym-Jomart Tokayev
summary: Kassym-Jomart Kemelevich Tokayev (Russian: Касы́м-Жома́рт Кеме́левич Тока́ев, Kazakh: Қасым-Жомарт Кемелұлы Тоқаев, romanized: Qаsym-Jomаrt Kemelūly Тoqаev, [qɑˈsəm ʒɔˈmɑrt kɛˌmɛluˈlə tɔˈqɑjɪf]; born 17 May 1953) is a Kazakh politician and diplomat who is currently serving as the President of Kazakhstan since 20 March 2019.[1][2] He succeeded Nursultan Nazarbayev, who resigned on 19 March 2019 after 29 years in office.[3]
